text: Probably the teams supporting those services use Slack, so we can still blame Slack :troll:

elements.text: Probably the teams supporting those services use Slack, so we can still blame Slack

text:
This is true.
AWS has a deal with Slack,
Slack uses Chime as their video backend and promises to use AWS as their cloud provider,
and in exchange Amazon roles out Slack as their chat program.

elements.text:
This is true.
AWS has a deal with Slack,
Slack uses Chime as their video backend and promises to use AWS as their cloud provider,
and in exchange Amazon roles out Slack as their chat program.

text: I suspect that this actually makes dealing with AWS issues notables worse since the deal basically ensures that their chat program doesn’t work when they are trying to sort out major outages.

elements.text: I suspect that this actually makes dealing with AWS issues notables worse since the deal basically ensures that their chat program doesn’t work when they are trying to sort out major outages.

text: You really want some kind of circular deal where Amazon promises to use Slack in change for slack promising to use Azure, in exchange for Microsoft Teams promising to use AWS Chime.
